snippet: Each section has a bold circle in the top, left-hand corner: some found the dots odd, but Gannett described them as “symbols of who we are.”
abstract: Each section has a bold circle in the top, left-hand corner: some found the dots odd, but Gannett described them as “symbols of who we are.”

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY and DAVID CARR

headline.main: Critics Find a Target in the Circles of USA Today's Redesign
